1.content: The memory of Josias is like the composition of a sweet smell made by the art of a perfumer:

2.content: His remembrance shall be sweet as honey in every mouth, and as music at a banquet of wine.

3.content: He was directed by God unto the repentance of the nation, and he took away the abominations of wickedness.

4.content: And he directed his heart towards the Lord, and in the days of sinners he strengthened godliness.

5.content: Except David, and Ezechias and Josias, all committed sin.

6.content: For the kings of Juda forsook the law of the most High, and despised the fear of God.

7.content: So they gave their kingdom to others, and their glory to a strange nation,

8.content: They burnt the chosen city of holiness, and made the streets thereof desolate according to the prediction of Jeremias.

9.content: For they treated him evil, who was consecrated a prophet from his mother's womb, to overthrow, and pluck up, and destroy, and to build again, and renew.

10.content: It was Ezechiel that saw the glorious vision, which was shewn him upon the chariot of cherubims.

11.content: For he made mention of the enemies under the figure of rain, and of doing good to them that shewed right ways.

12.content: And may the bones of the twelve prophets spring up out of their place: for they strengthened Jacob, and redeemed themselves by strong faith.

13.content: How shall we magnify Zorobabel? for he was as a signet on the right hand;

14.content: In like manner Jesus the son of Josedec who in their days built the house, and set up a holy temple to the Lord, prepared for everlasting glory.

15.content: And let Nehemias be a long time remembered, who raised up for us our walls that were cast down, and set up the gates and the bars, who rebuilt our houses.

16.content: No man was born upon earth like Henoch: for he also was taken up from the earth.

17.content: Nor as Joseph, who was a man born prince of his brethren, the support of his family, the ruler of his brethren, the stay of the people:

18.content: And his bones were visited, and after death they prophesied.

19.content: Seth and Sem obtained glory among men: and above every soul Adam in the beginning,

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
